article: How to Check if a 100 Dollar Bill Is Real

steps.title: Use a magnifying glass to find the microprint.
steps.subtitle: Check around Franklin’s jacket collar. You should see the words “The United States of America” in small type.
sub-points: You should also see “USA 100” around the white space that contains the portrait.
The words “100 USA” should also appear around the quill pen to the right of Franklin.

steps.title: Use a magnifying glass to find the microprint.
steps.subtitle: Check around Franklin’s jacket collar. You should see the words “The United States of America” in small type.
sub-points: You should also see “USA 100” around the white space that contains the portrait.
The words “100 USA” should also appear around the quill pen to the right of Franklin.

steps.title: Compare it with another bill.
steps.subtitle: No special security features were used on $100 bills printed before 1990. Accordingly, the best way to check its authenticity is to compare it to another $100. You might have to go to a bank to check if the bill is authentic.
sub-points: You can also visit the U.S. Currency website and find images of older $100 bills.
